trans-unit.source: Register for Azure Active Directory authentication | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Register for Azure Active Directory authentication | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to register for Azure Active Directory authentication in your Mobile Services application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to register for Azure Active Directory authentication in your Mobile Services application.

trans-unit.source: Register your apps to use an Azure Active Directory Account login
trans-unit.target: Register your apps to use an Azure Active Directory Account login

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to register your apps to be able to use Azure Active Directory as an authentication provider for your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to register your apps to be able to use Azure Active Directory as an authentication provider for your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Registering your app
trans-unit.target: Registering your app

trans-unit.source: The steps outlined in this topic are intended to be used with <link><linkText>Add Authentication to your Mobile Services app</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial when you want to use <link><linkText>Service-directed login operations</linkText><title></title></link> with your app.
trans-unit.target: The steps outlined in this topic are intended to be used with <link><linkText>Add Authentication to your Mobile Services app</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial when you want to use <link><linkText>Service-directed login operations</linkText><title></title></link> with your app.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, if your app has a requirement for <link><linkText>client-directed login operations</linkText><title></title></link> for Azure Active Directory and a .NET backend mobile service you should start with the <link><linkText>Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, if your app has a requirement for <link><linkText>client-directed login operations</linkText><title></title></link> for Azure Active Directory and a .NET backend mobile service you should start with the <link><linkText>Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], navigate to your mobile service, click the Identity tab, then scroll down to the Azure active directory identity provider section and copy the App URL shown there.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], navigate to your mobile service, click the Identity tab, then scroll down to the Azure active directory identity provider section and copy the App URL shown there.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Mobile service app URL for AAD</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Mobile service app URL for AAD</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Navigate to Active Directory in the management portal, click your directory then Domains and make a note of your directory's default domain.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to Active Directory in the management portal, click your directory then Domains and make a note of your directory's default domain.

trans-unit.source: Click Applications > Add > Add an application my organization is developing.
trans-unit.target: Click Applications > Add > Add an application my organization is developing.

trans-unit.source: In the Add Application Wizard, enter a Name for your application and click the Web application and/or Web API type.
trans-unit.target: In the Add Application Wizard, enter a Name for your application and click the Web application and/or Web API type.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Name your AAD app</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Name your AAD app</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Sign-on URL box, paste the app URL value you copied from your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In the Sign-on URL box, paste the app URL value you copied from your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Enter the same unique value in the App ID URI box, then click to continue.
trans-unit.target: Enter the same unique value in the App ID URI box, then click to continue.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set the AAD app properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set the AAD app properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After the application has been added, click the Configure tab and copy the Client ID for the app.
trans-unit.target: After the application has been added, click the Configure tab and copy the Client ID for the app.

trans-unit.source: For a .NET backend mobile service, you must also edit the Reply URL value under Single Sign-on to be the URL of your mobile service appended with the path, signin-aad.
trans-unit.target: For a .NET backend mobile service, you must also edit the Reply URL value under Single Sign-on to be the URL of your mobile service appended with the path, signin-aad.

trans-unit.source: For example, https://todolist.azure-mobile.net/signin-aad
trans-unit.target: For example, https://todolist.azure-mobile.net/signin-aad

trans-unit.source: Return to your mobile service's Identity tab and paste the copied Client ID value for the azure active directory identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Return to your mobile service's Identity tab and paste the copied Client ID value for the azure active directory identity provider.

trans-unit.source: In the Allowed Tenants list, type the domain of the directory in which you registered the application (such as contoso.onmicrosoft.com), then click Save.
trans-unit.target: In the Allowed Tenants list, type the domain of the directory in which you registered the application (such as contoso.onmicrosoft.com), then click Save.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use an Azure Active Directory for authentication in your app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use an Azure Active Directory for authentication in your app.
